creator: sambukkaa@hotmail.com
text:
I have installed the Apache server 2.0.52 on Win2k Advanced server with all 
updates. (surly without installing the MS server)
All works wonderful and fast (Perl,PHP,Sessions) but whenever I load the 
mod_logio.so into the server by adding this line into the .conf file like this:

LoadModule log_io_module modules/mod_logio.so

and reboot. The server prompts a system error system saying that Apache server 
service can't start.
If you ask if the file mod_logio.so exists? Yes it does.
Apache simply crashed and doesn't start.
I have removed the mod_logio.so from the .conf file and everything runs 
perfectly.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: *** Bug 33011 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

An error message would be helpful.
Add the line in the conf, cd into the apache/bin directory and type

apache -k restart
creator: nd@perlig.de
sambukkaa@hotmail.com
text:
I have followed your instructions and got this in the dos command line:

syntax error on line 169 of c:/apache2/conf/httpd.conf:
Can't locate API modul structure 'log_io_module' in file 
C:/Apache2/modules/mod_logio.so: No error

line 169 is this line: LoadModule log_io_module modules/mod_logio.so

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Ahaha. Well, I should have seen that earlier.
The identifier is not log_io_module, but logio_module (see
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.1/mod/mod_logio.html "Module Identifier").

When you replace it, it should work.

creator: sambukkaa@hotmail.com
text:
Yes, the server runs now. I haven’t test the %I O% options yet but I presume 
that the rest would function ok.
I'm sorry that I can't remember where I have found that syntax on the apache 
documentations, that way you would maybe edit it and save yourself lots of time.

Thanx
Tim
